result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin M Mehring was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Distribution to Minors, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $65.00 to Brandon M.; $38.00 to Heather S. and $7.00 to E.M.

EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid from 25% of prison funds. If not paid during period of extended Supervision, case converts to civil judgment. DV surcharge does not apply.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count four. Credit for 145 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim E.M. dob 11/4/01, without approval of the agent and guardian of E.M.
No firearms, weapons.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Random urine screens and breathalzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.  Credit for zero days.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions as listed on count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin M Mehring

records.addlTxt:
Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment 973.195 Signed, filed and disbursed. 

Denied because it is not in the public interest.  REASONS: The full time designated for initial confinement at sentencing is necessary to punish and deter the defendant. It would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense if the defendant did not serve 100% of the confinement time and defeat the purpose of the sentence, which was punishment, deterrence and community protection.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, for review. jbs
on count one.  Defendant's address:  Devin Mehring #101266, 717 Wisconsin Avenue, Racine, WI  53403.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (26 pages) commencing JULY 28, 2015 received and filed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Return of petitions for sentence adjustment on counts 1 & 4:  count 1 - initial confinement time has already been served, and count 4 - defendant hasn't served 75% of confinement time yet.

Defendant Devin M Mehring in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Devin M Mehring in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin
with Sarah Zwach (under the student practice rule).  
Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT #1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #4), with credit for 145 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS.  

AS TO COUNT #4: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. 

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, E.M. (11-4-01), without approval 
  of the agent and guardian of EM.   
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Court ordered defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges, 
   to be paid from 25% of prison funds, and if not paid during period 
   of extended supervision, case converts to civil judgment. 
   --- dv surcharge does not apply.
* Pay restitution in the amount of $65.00 to Brandon M.  
   $38.00 to Heather S. and $7.00 to E.M.  
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank 
   and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant advised of right to seek postconviction relief, and appeal
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.   mld

Defendant Devin M Mehring in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Devin M Mehring in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin 
with Sarah Zwach (under the student practice rule).   
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #2, #3 and #5, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS #1 and #4 (as charged): Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-16-2015 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Devin M Mehring in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Devin M Mehring in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  All available discovery and offer letter was turned over to defense counsel by the State.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-16-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 6-8-2015 at 8:30 am.  Offer will remain open until the date of the Final Pretrial Conference on 4-16-2015, per the State.   mld
